qas.question: When did Microsoft start creating Windows 8?
Where were the Windows 8 plans initially announced?
Who is Windows division vice president?
When did Microsoft start creating Windows 9?
Where were the Windows 9 plans initially announced?

context: Windows 8 development started <a0_0><b6_0>before Windows 7 had shipped in 2009<b6_0/><a0_0/>. At the <a3_0><b8_0>Consumer Electronics Show<b8_0/><a3_0/> in January 2011, it was announced that the next version of Windows would add support for ARM system-on-chips alongside the existing x86 processors produced by vendors, especially AMD and Intel. Windows division president <a1_0><b5_0>Steven Sinofsky<b5_0/><a1_0/> demonstrated an early build of the port on prototype devices, while Microsoft CEO <a2_0><b7_0>Steve Ballmer<b7_0/><a2_0/> announced the company's goal for Windows to be "everywhere on every kind of device without compromise." Details also began to surface about a <a4_0><b9_0>new application framework for Windows 8<b9_0/><a4_0/> codenamed "Jupiter", which would be used to make "immersive" applications using XAML (similarly to Windows Phone and Silverlight) that could be distributed via a new packaging system and a rumored application store.
